Protection.NameOfProject: Improving the lifes of vulnerable returnee- and host community households in Sinuni and Wana sub- districts through the provision of protection services and agricultural support (multi-cluster project)
Protection.Objective: The overall objective of the protection component is to expand general protection services (including legal assistance/counselling, PSS & HLP) to underserved areas with high needs in order to ensure safe and dignified returns and sustainable lives of people living in Arab villages and Neighboring villages in Sinuni Sub district, Sinjar districts.

ProtectionActivities.Activity: Protection Monitoring In Non Camps For Refugees Syrian And Non-Syrian
Protection Cases Recieved In Camps For Refugees

ProtectionHighlights.GeneralHighlights: protection team for refugees distributed 19 leaflets of hiygene instructions from COVI-19 in NonCamp locations.

protection team for refugees communicated with key informative Mukhtars and community volunteers to know the obstacles, challenges and issues occured to PoCs during the curfew and the lockdown in weekly basis and shared weekly reports with UNHCR.
protection team for refugees started working on online assessments of PMTv2 for the first two weeks of April, assessing the PoCs through viber and watsapp during the curfew.
Protection team of refugees resume their home visits after returning back to the office and continue thei regular work.

SGBVActivities.Activity: Non- structured psycho-social support (PSS) activities for children and adolescents
CP Awareness raising sessions on COVID-19
NON-GBV actors trained on GBV prevention and referral

SGBVHighlights.GeneralHighlights: Community listening centers conducted 98 online awareness key messages related to COVID-19 for different age groups, 40 women, 30 men, 42 boys and 30 girls attended. The purpose behind these session was to aware the community on how they will protect themselves and family members from Coronavirus and to manage their stress while staying at home.
APM for GBV conudcted three online meetings with CLC-Managers to discuss the staff challanges during the curfew and provide a new methodology for the activities.
APM for GBV has atteded GBVIMD data analysis quartely report meeting via Skype. The main aim of the meeting to discuss the trends of the cases and reason behind them.
APM for GBV has attended PSEA Duhok task force meeting via Skype to discuss and update Duhok PSEA workplan of 2020.
CACs have conducted awareness raising sessions on COVID-19 for children and parents through WhatsApp groups
Some non- structured psycho-social support (PSS) activities are being conducted for children and adolescents also through the WhatsApp groups.
CPO has attended CPWG via zoom on 27th April 2020 the main purpose was about the description on the current modality of program delivery ( family PSS kits and awareness-raising on COVID19).
GBV staff conducted some online awareness sessions on COVID-19 and total of  8704 members (2227 women, 2565 men, 2025 boys, and 1887 girls) were reached.
GBV staff  presented several online family PSS kits and total of 5346 (2367 women, 1352 girls, 617 men, and 1010 boys) were reached.

GBV staff in partnership with UNICEF organized an online drawing contest for children from three to twelve years old. 151 children (106 girls, and 45 boys) participated and total of 9 children won in the contest.
